title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, gather requirements, create a detailed project plan focusing on the following: security considerations (encryption methods, data protection policies), selection of appropriate file transfer protocols (SFTP, FTP, FTPS), implementation of malware detection mechanisms (antivirus scanners, heuristics analysis), and integration with existing systems. Provide a clear roadmap for each component and define the roles and responsibilities of team members.

title: System Architecture Design - Updated
description: Design the overall system architecture for SecureFileShare, including components, interfaces, data flow, security considerations, and scalability. The architecture will incorporate a front-end interface for users to upload/download files (with progressive enhancement for SFTP, FTP, and FTPS), a back-end server to handle file transfers, a malware detection engine, a database for metadata and user storage, and a secure storage system for files. This design will leverage microservices architecture to ensure scalability and maintainability. Proper authentication, authorization, and encryption mechanisms will be implemented for secure file transfers. Potential performance bottlenecks are addressed and recommendations for load balancing and caching strategies are provided, including the use of content delivery networks (CDNs) and opcode caches. Additional considerations include the integration of SFTP, FTP, and FTPS protocols within business-to-business workflows, as well as the implementation of webhooks for real-time notifications. The design will also prioritize the use of open-source libraries for maximum compatibility and flexibility.

title: Security Architecture and Threat Modeling
description: Design the security architecture, perform threat modeling to identify potential vulnerabilities, and document these findings. The security architecture should cover encryption (AES-256), authentication using OAuth or SSH keys, access control based on role-based access control (RBAC) and least privilege principle, secure communication protocols such as SFTP, FTPS, and TLS 1.3, malware detection mechanisms like YARA rules and ClamAV scanning, and implement rate limiting to mitigate Denial of Service attacks. Threat modeling should consider various attack vectors, such as man-in-the-middle attacks, brute-force attacks, malware injection, and denial of service attacks.

title: File Transfer Protocol Implementation
description: Implement secure file transfer protocols (SFTP, FTP, FTPS) for file sharing.

title: Malware Detection and Scanning
description: Integrate malware detection and scanning mechanisms to identify potential threats.

title: User Authentication and Authorization
description: Implement user authentication and authorization mechanisms for secure access control.

title: User Interface and Experience Design
description: Design the user interface and user experience for the file sharing application.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing user data, file metadata, and other relevant information.

title: Continuous Integration and Deployment Setup
description: Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline for automated builds, testing, and deployment.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute comprehensive testing strategies, including unit, integration, and end-to-end testing.

title: Documentation and User Guide
description: Create comprehensive documentation and user guides for the application.
